notes: Scaffold kinase initiating necrosome (RIPK1-RIPK3-MLKL); core necroptosis effector
Activates MLKL by phosphorylation to execute necroptosis
Pseudokinase that oligomerizes and permeabilizes membranes during necroptosis
RHIM-containing adaptor that triggers RIPK3-dependent necroptosis
TRIF (TICAM1) is a RHIM adaptor mediating TLR3/4-linked necroptotic signaling
PARP1 hyperactivation produces PAR polymers that trigger AIF translocation and parthanatos
AIF mediates caspase-independent DNA fragmentation following PAR signaling
MIF acts downstream of AIF in parthanatos execution
PARG modulates PAR turnover; role can be context-dependent in parthanatos
PAR glycohydrolase that can limit PAR accumulation and protect cells from PAR-driven death
Antioxidant transcription factor limiting oxidative damage and PARP1 activation
Cyclophilin D (PPIF) regulates MPT pore opening and MPT-driven regulated necrosis
Bax facilitates outer mitochondrial membrane permeabilization and supports MPT-associated necrosis
Bak cooperates with Bax in mitochondrial permeabilization events linked to regulated necrosis
BNIP3L can trigger mitochondrial death pathways and promote MPT-dependent necrosis
Drives PUFA-CoA incorporation into phospholipids promoting lipid peroxidation and ferroptosis
Lands-cycle enzyme remodeling phospholipids to favor ferroptotic substrates
Lipoxygenase contributing to enzymatic lipid peroxidation in ferroptosis
Transferrin receptor promotes iron uptake and ferroptosis susceptibility
Glutathione peroxidase 4 detoxifies lipid peroxides; central ferroptosis suppressor
Cystine/glutamate antiporter supplying substrate for GSH synthesis and GPX4 activity
Transcriptional master regulator of antioxidant defenses that limits ferroptosis
FSP1 regenerates CoQ to trap radicals and suppress ferroptosis
GCH1-BH4 pathway supports lipid antioxidant defenses against ferroptosis
Mitochondrial DHODH contributes to CoQH2 production and can prevent ferroptosis in mitochondria-rich contexts
Lysosomal cysteine cathepsin released upon LMP can execute caspase-independent cell death
Aspartic cathepsin implicated in lysosomal membrane permeabilization-driven death
Cysteine cathepsin contributing to lysosome-dependent caspase-independent death
Beclin1 is essential for autophagosome nucleation; required in many ADCD models
ATG5 conjugation to ATG12 is required for autophagy machinery and ADCD execution
E1-like enzyme essential for ATG conjugation systems required for ADCD
Initiation kinase for autophagy implicated in contexts of autophagy-dependent death
BCL2 binds BECN1 and inhibits autophagy initiation, limiting ADCD
